CRITICAL_NOTE.USE_INSTEAD: Interactive slider with TWO separate images
CRITICAL_NOTE.reason: Slider is more engaging and works better on mobile

structure.BEFORE: How other pieces made her feel (the disappointment)
structure.AFTER: How THIS piece makes her feel (the confidence)

comparison_framing.WRONG: Feature A vs Feature B (tech specs)
comparison_framing.RIGHT: How you felt BEFORE vs How you'll feel NOW

before_column.headline: What you're used to
items: Looked good online, disappointing in person

after_column.headline: What you deserve
items: Looks even better than the photos

placement.reason: Show the transformation EARLY - she needs to see what's possible

tone_guidance.write_like: Showing her the difference between settling and finding the one

anti_laziness_check: Does BEFORE describe feelings, not features?
Does AFTER describe transformation, not specs?
Would she see herself in the BEFORE column?
Would she WANT to be in the AFTER column?
Am I using TWO separate images (not a single combined one)?
